title: Revolutionary Leaders Quiz
description: Can you recall the leaders who sparked revolutions and changed the course of history?

questions.question: Who was the principal author of the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: Thomas Jefferson was the principal author of the Declaration of Independence, drafted in June 1776.

questions.question: Which leader of the French Revolution was known as 'The Incorruptible'?
questions.explanation: Maximilien Robespierre earned the nickname 'The Incorruptible' for his rigid adherence to his principles, though he oversaw the Reign of Terror.

questions.question: Who led the Haitian Revolution, the only successful slave revolt in history?
questions.explanation: Toussaint Louverture was the most prominent leader of the Haitian Revolution, which began in 1791 and led to Haiti's independence in 1804.

questions.question: Who led the Cuban Revolution and became Cuba's leader in 1959?
questions.explanation: Fidel Castro led the Cuban Revolution that overthrew the Batista regime in 1959 and ruled Cuba for nearly five decades.

questions.question: Which South American liberator freed much of the continent from Spanish rule?
questions.explanation: Simón Bolívar, known as 'The Liberator,' led independence movements across Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Bolivia.

questions.question: Who led India's non-violent independence movement against British rule?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi led India's independence movement through non-violent civil disobedience, achieving independence in 1947.

questions.question: Which leader sparked the Protestant Reformation by nailing his 95 Theses to a church door?
questions.explanation: Martin Luther posted his 95 Theses on the door of the Castle Church in Wittenberg in 1517, launching the Protestant Reformation.

questions.question: Who was the leader of the Bolshevik Revolution in Russia in 1917?
questions.explanation: Vladimir Lenin led the Bolsheviks in the October Revolution of 1917, establishing the world's first communist state.

questions.question: Which Chinese revolutionary leader founded the Republic of China in 1912?
questions.explanation: Sun Yat-sen is considered the 'Father of the Nation' in China for his role in overthrowing the Qing Dynasty and founding the Republic of China.

questions.question: Who was the Argentine revolutionary who fought alongside Fidel Castro?
questions.explanation: Ernesto 'Che' Guevara was an Argentine Marxist revolutionary who played a key role in the Cuban Revolution alongside Fidel Castro.

questions.question: Which Mexican revolutionary leader fought for land reform and peasant rights?
questions.explanation: Emiliano Zapata led the peasant revolution in southern Mexico, fighting under the slogan 'Tierra y Libertad' (Land and Liberty).

questions.question: Who led the Irish rebellion at the General Post Office in the 1916 Easter Rising?
questions.explanation: Patrick Pearse was the commander-in-chief of the Easter Rising and proclaimed the Irish Republic from the GPO in Dublin in 1916.

questions.question: Which Turkish leader established the Republic of Turkey from the Ottoman Empire's ashes?
questions.explanation: Mustafa Kemal Atatürk founded the Republic of Turkey in 1923 and implemented sweeping modernization reforms.

questions.question: Which Polish labor leader founded the Solidarity movement?
questions.explanation: Lech Walesa co-founded the Solidarity trade union in 1980, which played a crucial role in ending communist rule in Poland.

questions.question: Who was the first president of the United States, leading the nation after the American Revolution?
questions.explanation: George Washington served as the first President of the United States from 1789 to 1797, having led the Continental Army during the Revolution.
